sentences.english: Some soldiers were told off to dig ditches.
sentences.chinese: 一些士兵被派去挖壕沟。
壕沟被用砖覆盖起来了。

sentences.english: "No Man's Land" is traditionally known as the area between two trenches on a battlefield.
sentences.chinese: “无人区”往往指的是战场上敌我壕沟之间的区域。

sentences.english: The distribution of root systems of two apricot species was observed by the Oskamp method.
sentences.chinese: 用改良壕沟法对两个杏品种根系分布进行观察。

sentences.english: They builtneither stockades nor trenches around their camps.
sentences.chinese: 在他们的营地周围，他们既不筑栅栏也不挖壕沟。

sentences.english: It had jackknifed into a ditch and had to be abandoned by its crew.
sentences.chinese: 大炮身管弯曲，扎在一道壕沟里，已被炮组丢弃。

sentences.english: Our soldiers have entrenched themselves behind the battle lines.
sentences.chinese: 我们的士兵们在战线后面挖壕沟防御。

sentences.english: The next day the mother duck with her family went down to the moat.
sentences.chinese: 隔天这只母鸭带着她的一家人走到壕沟。

sentences.english: With a decent pair of binoculars you have time to dig a moat against the buggers.
sentences.chinese: 还是带一架望远镜算准时间，赶紧挖个壕沟防止爆菊。

sentences.english: The moat is quite deep – up to 3 meters in some places.
sentences.chinese: 壕沟非常深，有些地方达到了3米深。

sentences.english: The troops were en trenched near the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 部队在群山边筑起壕沟以防卫自己。

sentences.english: You know why you hid in that ditch, Blithe?
sentences.chinese: 你知道你为何躲在那个壕沟里吗，布洛依？

definition: defensive structure/military fortifications/(Tw) construction works/civil engineering works
cheval de frise (a type of barrier)
Muzha (old spelling: Mucha), suburb to the southeast of Taipei
